SourceProxy.name: PersistenceDiagramClustering
SourceProxy.label: TTK PersistenceDiagramClustering

Documentation.long_help: TTK plugin for the computation of distances, barycenters and clustering within a set of persistence diagrams.
Documentation.shorthelp: TTK plugin for the computation of distances, barycenters and clustering within a set of persistence diagrams.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
Given an input set of persistence diagrams and a number of clusters, this plugin computes a clustering of the persistence diagrams using a progressive and interruptible K-Means approach. The result of the clustering is printed in the console. The clustered diagrams and the corresponding centroid diagrams are produced, as well as the assignment between the critical points.
If the number of clusters is set to 1 (default value), the Wasserstein barycenter of the set is computed using the same algorithm.
If the number of clusters is set to 1 and there are only two input diagrams, by default their Wasserstein distance is computed with the Auction algorithm, and the barycenter is deduced from the assignments. The use of the progressive approach can nevertheless be toggled in the Properties menu.
Related publication: "Progressive Wasserstein Barycenters of Persistence Diagrams" Jules Vidal, Joseph Budin, Julien Tierny IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics. Proceedings of IEEE VIS 2019.
See also PersistenceDiagram, BottleneckDistance

IntVectorProperty.name: Method
IntVectorProperty.label: Algorithm

Entry.text: Classical Auction approach (one cluster only, SLOW)

IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Type of algorithm for the computation of the barycenter. The Auction algorithm is computationally more expensive than the progressive approach.

IntVectorProperty.name: ForceUseOfAlgorithm
IntVectorProperty.label: Force the progressive approach if 2 inputs
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When there are only two input diagrams and one cluster, the progressive approach is not used by default to compute the barycenter. Instead, the Auction Algorithm is used to compute the Wasserstein distance between the two diagrams, and the barycenter is deduced from the corresponding assignments without additional computationnal cost. This option forces the use of the progressive approach to compute the barycenter.

IntVectorProperty.name: Critical pairs
IntVectorProperty.label: Critical pairs used for the clustering
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify the types of critical pairs to be taken into account for the clustering.

StringVectorProperty.name: n
StringVectorProperty.label: p parameter
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Value of the parameter p for the Wp (p-th Wasserstein) distance computation (type "inf" for the Bottleneck distance).

IntVectorProperty.name: Deterministic
IntVectorProperty.label: Deterministic algorithm
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Removes any randomness in the initialization of barycenters.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseProgressive
IntVectorProperty.label: Compute Progressive Barycenter
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If set to true, the barycenter is computed progressively (starting with most persistent pairs). The option may turn useful coupled with Interruptible Algorithm since the Barycenter will be computed with only a portion of the input points if computation time gets too important.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseInterruptible
IntVectorProperty.label: Interruptible algorithm
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Enforce a time limit for the computation.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TimeLimit
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximal computation time (s)
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Maximal time of computation for the computation of the barycenter. A low value of Time Limit will yield approximate results.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseAdditionalPrecision
IntVectorProperty.label: Force minimum precision on matchings
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Force the final matchings to respect a given relative precision.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: DeltaLim
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Minimal relative precision
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimal precision for the approximation of the Wasserstein distance used in the assignment between diagrams.

IntVectorProperty.name: DisplayMethod
IntVectorProperty.label: Displaying method
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Choose the displaying of the result.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: spacing_
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Spacing
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Ajust the spacing for the display of diagrams.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseAccelerated
IntVectorProperty.label: Use Accelerated KMeans
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Whether or not to use the triangular inequality too fasten the computation of the clustering. If activated, the option saves time. However it may lead to slightly inaccurate classification due to the approximations made during the computation of distance.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseKmeansppInit
IntVectorProperty.label: KMeanspp Initialization
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If activated, the clustering is initialized cleverly. The option may avoid local minima at the cost of some initial computations proportionnal to the product of the number of clusters and the number of diagrams.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: AntiAlpha
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Geometrical Lifting (alpha)
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Blending coefficient for the cost evaluation of each critical point matching. By default (1), only distances in the persistence diagrams are considered between matched critical points. When set to 0, only distances in the original 3D domain are considered between matched critical points.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Lambda
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Extremas weight in blending
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Parametrizes the point used for the geometrical coordinates of the persistence pair. Set to 1 to choose the potential extremum, for an increased stability. Set to 0 to choose the other point (saddle point). This is not advised. Set to 0.5 to choose the geometrical middle of the pair points (bad stability)

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDistanceMatrix
IntVectorProperty.label: Output a Distance Matrix
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Output the distance matrix between all input persistence diagrams.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseFullDiagrams
IntVectorProperty.label: Use Full Diagrams (SLOW!)
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute the distance matrix between the full diagrams.

IntVectorProperty.name: PerClusterDistanceMatrix
IntVectorProperty.label: Per Cluster Distance Matrix
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Restrict the distance matrix computation to persistence diagrams sharing the same cluster. Persistence diagrams in different clusters will have a distance set to +infinity.
